personal_summary: Electronics and Communication Engineering graduate with practical experience in embedded systems and VLSI design through academic projects and training at Rugved Systems. Proficient in multi-layer PCB design, signal integrity optimization, and hands-on FPGA and antenna design. Strong project coordination skills with a focus on delivering innovative solutions to real-world challenges.

education.degree: B. Tech in Electronics and Communications
highlights: Specialized in Embedded Systems with hands-on experience in RTOS, ARM Cortex MCUs, and FPGA programming
Developed Verilog-based logic blocks and tested digital designs using Vivado & EDA Playground
Built and simulated analog circuits using Cadence; applied to real-world PCB projects
Practiced digital signal processing (DSP) using MATLAB and Simulink for system simulations

experience.title: Electronics Lead
responsibilities: Led embedded systems projects using Arduino, ESP32, and STM32 (e.g., line follower bot, WALRUS)
Designed multi-layer PCBs using KiCad, EasyEDA, and Altium, optimizing signal integrity and EMI
Developed wireless systems for RC cars and drones with LoRa, ESP32, and UART/I2C/SPI/CAN protocols
Simulated electronic circuits using Multisim, LTSpice, and Proteus to enhance design accuracy
Negotiated contracts with suppliers to secure favorable terms for materials procurement

experience.title: Summer Intern
responsibilities: Gained hands-on experience with SCADA systems, MPLS-TP networks, L2/L3 switch and firewall setup
Assisted in configuring FRTUs, modems, and secure telephony using IEC61850/104 protocols
Worked on real-time data acquisition, OTDR testing, fiber splicing, and antenna installations
Explored substation automation, network management, and cybersecurity practices
